Name: Mummiform coffin
Description: Wooden coffin, covered with plaster and painted. The chest is covered by a very broad and well executed ornate collar. Underneath this are registers separated by triglyphic bands: winged scarabs, divine barks, gods in front of an offering table, a mummy on a bier with accompanying gods, a body hovering over a pool and finally two scenes of adoration. The back is painted with a bead net on a red background. The two columns of text on the back pillar contain the offering formula. The inside of the coffin is undecorated.
